noun.description: A lump or bundle of a soft material, used for padding, stuffing, or wiping.
A bundle of paper, banknotes, or documents.
examples: a thick wad of index cards

verb.description: Compress (a soft material) into a lump or bundle.
Line or stuff (a garment or piece of furniture) with wadding.

phrases: I see bike companies and other sponsors shoot their wad for road season and have nothing to invest come winter.
origin: Mid 16th century (denoting wadding): perhaps related to Dutch watten, French ouate padding, cotton wool.
